entry.title: Need API to Trigger Outbound Payment Status After Bank Rec (IHC Scenario)
entry.content:
Hello Community,

We are working on a scenario in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508 and need guidance on the best approach for an integration.

Scenario Overview:

We have implemented Inhouse Cash (IHC) with Payment Orders.

Supplier Invoices are created and tagged in a third-party system.

These invoices are successfully sent to and processed within S/4HANA.

The payment process runs in S4, and bank statements are posted using in S4 viaBANK_STATEMENT_POST_IN API to perform reconciliation.

Our Requirement:
Immediately after the bank statement is posted and invoices are reconciled (marked as paid in S4), we need to send the payment status (e.g., "Cleared" or "Paid") back to the third-party system via a pre-built interface.

We’ve Researched and aware that BusinessPartnerPaymentStatus OData API to read the status, but we need a trigger to push the data. We have explored Outbound Services (SOAP) but are unsure which one is raised post-bank reconciliation.

My Question:
What is the recommended API or Event we can leverage to trigger our logic after a successful BANK_STATEMENT_POST_IN. Our goal is to identify all invoices paid during that reconciliation run and push their status out to third party system.

We would greatly appreciate if you share your expertise :

The specific Business Event or Outbound Service that is triggered by a bank statement posting/reconciliation.

If a direct API is not available, what is the recommended extension strategy (e.g., a side-by-side extension listening to an event) to achieve this in the public cloud?

Thank you in advance for your time and expertise.

Regards,

Mahavir

entry.title: RERAPP Save Variant issue
entry.content:
Hello,
We had some issues with RERAPP today where a saved variant was pulling different information in on one person"s computer which was different from the details which were saved on the other users computer. Specifically, a random contract number previously entered in contract field of RERAPP was being pulled into the variant when it was ran by the 2nd employee.

We don"t understand why RERAPP pulling previously run contract information as default when we try to execute it with variant. Please advise.

Thanks,

 

Jayant Patel

Now we need  to change the domain of these emails. Example: someone1@sender1.com to someone2@sender2.com

entry.title: Fiscal Year and Posting Period
entry.content:

But whenever I am creating a fiscal year and posting period, I am making the full month open and not a part of it which is on the basis of date. So, is there any way to manage this scenario.

entry.title: Case Study: Gift card given to suppliers to be reflected on 1099 NEC
entry.content:
The business wants to ensure that the value of all gift cards given to suppliers is properly reflected on Form 1099-NEC.

As is the process: Gift card is handled in a spreadsheet, and 1099 is  adjusted manually 

Now: We have implemented S4HANA 2022 and are using the App " run statutory reports" in Fiori ( Basic statutory report)

How do we record them? Since gift cards are cash equivalents and compensatory in nature, their value must be tracked as non-employee compensation.  Thanks for your help.

entry.title: SAP BTE 1120: Document Header Information Processing and Customization
entry.content:
In SAP ERP and S/4HANA systems, different extension options are offered to make business processes flexible according to customer needs. One of these extension tools is the Business Transaction Events (BTE) structure.

BTE 1120 allows user-defined changes on the document header and items during FI document posting. With this structure, some fields of the document can be updated, changed, or replaced with a fixed value automatically depending on conditions.

BTE 1120 makes it possible to change some fields in BKPF (document header) and BSEG (document items) tables before the document is posted. SAP provides the example function module SAMPLE_INTERFACE_00001120 as a basis for this development.

With this structure, many scenarios can be done, for example:
📌Assigning a fixed text to the document header reference text field (BKPF_SUBST-BKTXT)
📌Updating the value date of a document item (BSEG_SUBST-VALUT) depending on a condition
📌Changing the line item text (BSEG_SUBST-SGTXT) for the customer
📌Assigning a payment block key (BSEG_SUBST-ZLSPR) to a document item
📌Changing fields like cost center or activity type according to business rules

Thanks to this exit, when customer documents are posted (for example FB70, F-28, F-32 etc.), you can change values, assign new ones, or manipulate indirect data line by line.

During document posting, the fields XBLNR1 and/or BKTXT in the document header can be replaced with a new field or changed with a fixed value. This allows you to make changes at the time of posting.

During document posting, the fields ZLSPR and/or VALUT in the document item can be replaced with a new field or changed with a fixed value. This makes it possible to modify them at the time of posting.

Application on a Live Scenario:
The user asked us the following:
In personnel expense postings, in the automatically created FI documents, the item text from the personnel line should also appear in all other lines. Also, when posting, the personnel customer code should be added at the beginning of this text. This process should not be done manually, it should work automatically.

This requirement can be done by writing code with BTE 1120. Below, I will explain how to do this.

  DATA: lv_sgtxt   TYPE bseg-sgtxt,
        lv_lıfnr   TYPE bseg-lıfnr,
        lv_found   TYPE abap_bool,
        ls_bseg    TYPE bseg,
        ls_bsegsub TYPE bseg_subst.
  DATA lv_tabix TYPE sy-tabix.

    READ TABLE t_bkpf INTO DATA(ls_bkpf) INDEX 1.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0 OR ls_bkpf-blart <> 'PG'.
    RETURN. " PG değilse çık
  ENDIF.

  LOOP AT t_bseg INTO ls_bseg.
    IF ls_bseg-umskz = '1' AND ls_bseg-sgtxt IS NOT INITIAL.
      lv_sgtxt = ls_bseg-sgtxt.
      lv_lıfnr = ls_bseg-lıfnr.
      lv_found = abap_true.
      EXIT.
    ENDIF.
  ENDLOOP.
  
  IF lv_found = abap_true.
    LOOP AT t_bseg INTO ls_bseg.
      lv_tabix = sy-tabix.

      READ TABLE t_bsegsub INTO ls_bsegsub INDEX lv_tabix.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        CONCATENATE lv_lıfnr lv_sgtxt INTO ls_bsegsub-sgtxt SEPARATED BY space.
        MODIFY t_bsegsub FROM ls_bsegsub INDEX lv_tabix.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDIF.

After the 1120 development was completed, a unit test was done with the transaction code F-02 by entering a document. Before the posting was finished, the explanations entered in the text field were as follows.

Revision of the text field according to the customer’s request after posting.

In conclusion, BTE 1120 is a strong SAP enhancement point that allows field-level changes during the document creation process. It is especially used when field values in automatically created FI documents need to be replaced according to non-standard rules. Its ability to provide direct solutions for real-life requirements and remove manual intervention makes 1120 a frequently used method in SAP projects.

I hope my writing will be helpful to you.

Best Regards,

Abdullah Kaba

SAP S/4HANA Finance #

entry.title: What is SAP BTE 1120 and how is it used?
entry.content:
In SAP ERP and S/4HANA systems, different extension options are offered to make business processes flexible according to customer needs. One of these extension tools is the Business Transaction Events (BTE) structure.

BTE 1120 allows user-defined changes on the document header and items during FI document posting. With this structure, some fields of the document can be updated, changed, or replaced with a fixed value automatically depending on conditions.

BTE 1120 makes it possible to change some fields in BKPF (document header) and BSEG (document items) tables before the document is posted. SAP provides the example function module SAMPLE_INTERFACE_00001120 as a basis for this development.

With this structure, many scenarios can be done, for example:
📌Assigning a fixed text to the document header reference text field (BKPF_SUBST-BKTXT)
📌Updating the value date of a document item (BSEG_SUBST-VALUT) depending on a condition
📌Changing the line item text (BSEG_SUBST-SGTXT) for the customer
📌Assigning a payment block key (BSEG_SUBST-ZLSPR) to a document item
📌Changing fields like cost center or activity type according to business rules

Thanks to this exit, when customer documents are posted (for example FB70, F-28, F-32 etc.), you can change values, assign new ones, or manipulate indirect data line by line.

 

During document posting, the fields XBLNR1 and/or BKTXT in the document header can be replaced with a new field or changed with a fixed value. This allows you to make changes at the time of posting.

 

During document posting, the fields ZLSPR and/or VALUT in the document item can be replaced with a new field or changed with a fixed value. This makes it possible to modify them at the time of posting.

 

Application on a Live Scenario:
The user asked us the following:
In personnel expense postings, in the automatically created FI documents, the item text from the personnel line should also appear in all other lines. Also, when posting, the personnel customer code should be added at the beginning of this text. This process should not be done manually, it should work automatically.

This requirement can be done by writing code with BTE 1120. Below, I will explain how to do this.

 

  DATA: lv_sgtxt   TYPE bseg-sgtxt,
        lv_lıfnr   TYPE bseg-lıfnr,
        lv_found   TYPE abap_bool,
        ls_bseg    TYPE bseg,
        ls_bsegsub TYPE bseg_subst.
  DATA lv_tabix TYPE sy-tabix.

    READ TABLE t_bkpf INTO DATA(ls_bkpf) INDEX 1.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0 OR ls_bkpf-blart <> 'PG'.
    RETURN. " PG değilse çık
  ENDIF.

  LOOP AT t_bseg INTO ls_bseg.
    IF ls_bseg-umskz = '1' AND ls_bseg-sgtxt IS NOT INITIAL.
      lv_sgtxt = ls_bseg-sgtxt.
      lv_lıfnr = ls_bseg-lıfnr.
      lv_found = abap_true.
      EXIT.
    ENDIF.
  ENDLOOP.
  
  IF lv_found = abap_true.
    LOOP AT t_bseg INTO ls_bseg.
      lv_tabix = sy-tabix.

      READ TABLE t_bsegsub INTO ls_bsegsub INDEX lv_tabix.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        CONCATENATE lv_lıfnr lv_sgtxt INTO ls_bsegsub-sgtxt SEPARATED BY space.
        MODIFY t_bsegsub FROM ls_bsegsub INDEX lv_tabix.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDIF.

After the 1120 development was completed, a unit test was done with the transaction code F-02 by entering a document. Before the posting was finished, the explanations entered in the text field were as follows.

Revision of the text field according to the customer’s request after posting.

 

In conclusion, BTE 1120 is a strong SAP enhancement point that allows field-level changes during the document creation process. It is especially used when field values in automatically created FI documents need to be replaced according to non-standard rules. Its ability to provide direct solutions for real-life requirements and remove manual intervention makes 1120 a frequently used method in SAP projects.

I hope my writing will be helpful to you.

Best Regards,

Abdullah Kaba

entry.title: Error creating number group range for range object: EDOC_ESVF (eDocument Spain Verifactu)
entry.content:
Hello everyone!

 

I'm having trouble creating a new number range for the EDOC_ESVF object in SAP Public Cloud. (ID 106923 in Central Business Configuration)

Currently, the default range is 01, which is used by Company A. When I try to create a range for Company B, the option to create cannot be modified. Additionally, when I try the "Copy subobject" option, I get an authorization error.

I created a new role with the corresponding transaction, but even after assigning it, the field still appears as read-only.

Why is SAP not allowing me to create a new range? The documentation explicitly states that I should add as many ranges as the company requires:

(https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a624a4a6d1d8473eb95fb42660127cfe/0c12ba22b3fb4119b0c34475523debe2.html?locale=en-US) 

Any suggestion?

Thanks in advance!

kr

NIco

entry.title: 外貨で赤黒合計0円の自動支払処理をする際に、支払が分かれてしまう
entry.content:
事象概要

自動支払処理（F110）において、同一仕入先に対する外貨建ての請求伝票（黒伝票）と貸方伝票（赤伝票）を同額で相殺した場合、本来は 0 金額で相殺されることを期待しているが、支払提案処理では支払が分割されて提案されてしまう。

詳細条件

  • トランザクション：F110（自動支払処理）

  • 通貨：SGD（他の外貨でも同様に発生）

  • 伝票条件：

    • 請求伝票（黒伝票）：100 SGD

    • クレジットメモ（赤伝票）：–100 SGD

    • 支払方法、銀行キー、会社コード、支払通貨などは一致

  • 円貨（JPY）の場合：

    • 同様のケースでは支払提案がまとまり、0 支払として処理可能

結果

  • 外貨の場合のみ、支払提案にて支払が分割される

期待動作

  • 外貨建ての場合も円貨と同様に、赤伝票と黒伝票の合計が 0 になる場合は一括で相殺され、支払が分割されないこと

補足

  • 伝票条件（支払方法、銀行キー、通貨など）は一致していることを確認済み

  • 内貨（JPY）では問題なく 0 支払として消し込まれることを確認済み

  • 外貨のみで POKEN フラグが立つため、これが原因と推測しているが、なぜ外貨のみこの挙動となるのか不明

Issue Summary

In the Automatic Payment Program (F110), when offsetting a foreign currency vendor invoice (debit/black line item) against a credit memo (credit/red line item) for the same vendor with exactly the same amount, it is expected that the payment proposal will net to zero and no payment will be generated. However, in the payment proposal, the items are split and treated as separate payments.

Detailed Conditions

  • Transaction: F110 (Automatic Payment Program)

  • Currency: SGD (the same behavior occurs with other foreign currencies as well)

  • Document conditions:

    • Invoice (debit/black): 100 SGD

    • Credit memo (credit/red): –100 SGD

    • Payment method, house bank, company code, and payment currency are identical between the two documents

  • Behavior in local currency (JPY):

    • In similar cases in JPY, the payment proposal correctly nets the items together, resulting in a zero payment which can be processed without splitting

Actual Result

  • Only in the case of foreign currency, the payment proposal splits the items into separate payments

  • In the proposal log, the flag REGUE-POKEN (item-level payment indicator) is set, causing the items to be treated as individual payments

Expected Behavior

  • Even for foreign currency, when the invoice and the credit memo net to zero, the items should be grouped together in the payment proposal and no payment should be generated

  • The behavior should be consistent with local currency (JPY)

Additional Notes

  • All document conditions (payment method, house bank, currency, etc.) are confirmed to be identical

  • In local currency (JPY), zero payments are handled correctly

  • The POKEN flag is only set in foreign currency cases, which seems to be the root cause, but it is unclear why this happens only for foreign currencies

entry.title: Payment term block issue
entry.content:
Dear Gurus and Experts 

As per requirement from business .PAYMENT TERM (Z888)need to be blocked.

But condition is that, it should not impact invoices for which payments are due. Means it should be done for future  payments not for one for which invoice already done with mentioned payment term(Z888)

And it should not impact POs for which GRN already been done and INVOICE posting payment are due with reference to mentioned payment term.

And in future while creating PO mentioned payment term (Z888) should not appeared (although we can not delete payment term as its master data creation)

Reply awaited

Thanks and Regards,

Aman Jain

FIN (Finance) MM Invoice Verification FIN Accounts Receivable and Payable
